resources.string: VASIR - Visual Analog Scale Intelligibility Rating
Do you want to discard unsaved ratings in this session and create a new rating session?
No usable audio files were found in the %s directory.
The loaded session is missing the following files (total %1$d) in the directory %2$s:\n%3$s
Error message: Extracting full path from document selection URI failed!
No previous rating session was found. Please create a new session.
Previous session is corrupted. Please create a new session.
Are you sure you want to delete the selected result from the device? This operation is irreversible.
Current session could not be saved.<\br>Reason: %s <\br>Do you want to continue with creating a new session? Current ratings will be lost.
Are you sure you want to quit\?
There is only one file in session, and it is not supported. Please select some other valid directory.
Select result from the list to view detailed info.
New session creation cancelled - no directory selected.

Loading of saved rating files failed!<\br> Reason: %s
App will show the welcome screen on startup
App will show the rating screen on startup
Number of backup result save files
Report technical issues or suggest new features

\tVASIR is an application that utilizes visual analog scales for subjective speech intelligibility rating.\n \tIf you\'re already familiar with this application, feel free to continue below and start rating. To find out more info about how to use this app, scroll down in this panel.

After proceeding, the app will ask you to select a directory containing the audio files of speech recordings to be rated. The location of the files is arbitrary, but we recommend saving them to a standard directory on your phone's internal storage (e.g. the Documents folder).

 	Afterwards, the app performs a randomization on the found audio files and prepares them for rating. You can browse through the available files using the build-in player, listen to their contents through headphones, and finally, rate them on the continuous analog scale located to the bottom of the rating screen. When all available files have been rated, a double checkmark icon will appear. The current session is saved automatically on app exit, but can be also saved manually using the dropdown menu in the top-right corner. This menu also allows you to see the saved recordings and share them via Cloud, email, etc. 

 This application was developed for use in research and development in the department of circuit theory, faculty of electrotechnics, CTU in Prague.
Do not show this screen again
VASIR application logo, icons of a person speaking to an ear
Bitstream is not conforming to the related coding standard or file specification
There are no saved ratings here yet! You can save a session manually via the corresponding option in the dropdown menu.
Group name must not contain these characters: ~#^|$%&*!?<>/
Image showing screenshot of application content relatex to the context of the help being displayed.

string-array.name: help_tag_description_rating_fragment
string-array.item: Current position in the list of all recordings.
Icon indicating that the current recordings has already been rated. After all recordings have been rated, a double-checkmark icon will appear.
Current playback position in format [mm:ss].
Total playback time of the current recording.
Horizontal bar enabling seeking over the whole recording.
Player control buttons. Long-press on the previous/next button takes you to the first/last recording in the list.
Rating bar. Values furthest to the right typically represent best performance, furthest to the left represent the worst performance.

string-array.name: help_tag_description_settings_fragment
string-array.item: This setting restores showing of the welcome screen on app\'s startup, in case you previously check you don\'t want to see it again.
Number of save file backups for every session, that will be kept in memory. Allowed input: 0–100 backups.
Shows information about the current version of the app.
Allows you to send feedback to the developers.

string-array.name: help_tag_description_results_fragment
string-array.item: List of saved sessions, sorted chronologically with the lastest saved session on top. List items can be clicked on to display detailed session info. Long-press enables to delete the save.
Session\'s date and time of saving.
Message hinting at the option to click on list items to see detailed info. Automatically disappears after a while.
Share all saved sessions button. A share mode (plain text/excel file) and a share target can be selected after pressing.

string-array.name: help_tag_description_result_detail_fragment
string-array.item: Session name.
Session info: Save date, randomization seed, creation date. Values can be copied.
List of all recordings in the session. List can be sorted both ascendingly or descendingly by pressing on the column headers.
List items: Recording\'s ID, group name, randomization index, set recording\'s rating.
Session share button. A share mode (plain text/excel file) and a share target can be selected after pressing.

string-array.name: help_tag_description_group_control_fragment
string-array.item: List of all found folders that store eligible recordings.
Found folder\'s name and a number of eligible recordings within.

Group label, that will be assigned to all recordings from the specified folder. Default value is the folder\'s name. This label is used solely for display and export purposes and will not in any manned affect the randomization of the recordings.
Checkbox enabling exclusion (inclusion) of selected groups from the new session.
Confirm button. It is obligatory to leave at least one group enabled.

string-array.name: help_tag_description_current_session_info_fragment
string-array.item: Current session\'s name.
Current session info: Randomization seed, creation date. Values can be copied.
List of all recordings in the current session. List can be sorted both ascendingly or descendingly by pressing on the column headers.
List items: Recording\'s ID, group name, randomization index, set recording\'s rating.
Current session share button. A share mode (plain text/excel file) and a share target can be selected after pressing.
